snippet: The federal trial for Dylann Roof, the man charged in the deaths of nine people at Charleston’s historic Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in June, was delayed Thursday as prosecutors told a judge that they had not decided whether to seek...
abstract: Federal hate crime trial for Dylann Roof is delayed after prosecutors inform judge that they have not decided whether to pursue death penalty sentence; Roof also faces state murder charges for attack on Charleston, SC, Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church.
lead_paragraph: The federal trial for Dylann Roof, the man charged in the deaths of nine people at Charleston’s historic Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in June, was delayed Thursday as prosecutors told a judge that they had not decided whether to seek the death penalty.

headline.print_headline: South Carolina: Trial Delayed in Church Massacre
headline.main: South Carolina: Trial Delayed in Church Massacre
